content:
Diagnosis:		Grade 1 pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor

Management:		Distal pancreatectomy March 2023

Histology:		Well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor, pT2N0, Ki67 2%, synaptophysin and chromogranin positive

Current Situation:	Routine surveillance review

[redacted name] has attended for routine follow-up today. She remains well with no new symptoms since her surgery last year. Her appetite is good and weight is stable at 68kg. Recent chromogranin A level shows continued stability at 82 (previously 85). CT pancreas protocol performed 2 weeks ago shows post-surgical changes only with no evidence of recurrence. Blood glucose remains well controlled on metformin.

The plan is to continue surveillance as per protocol. I have arranged chromogranin A testing for 3 months and CT scan in 6 months. We will review her again following these investigations.

cancer_timeline.value: CT pancreas protocol shows post-surgical changes only with no evidence of recurrence

status_updates.value: Grade 1 pancreatic NET post distal pancreatectomy. Stable disease on surveillance with normal imaging and biomarkers
No evidence of recurrence on imaging
Chromogranin A in 3 months and CT scan in 6 months
